result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher D Hughes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay a $200 DNA surcharge. 
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 6/3/2017. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: concurrent to case no. 13CF194.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher D Hughes

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: ORDER TO PRODUCE     RECEIVED AND FILED

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   

The Court ordered defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to case no. 13CF194. 

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay a $200 DNA surcharge. 

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 6/3/2017. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Christopher D Hughes in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Christopher D Hughes in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Court ordered all previous conditions to remain the same.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Christopher D Hughes not in court, in custody at MSDF and not produced.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered bench warrant cancelled and bail reinstated.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31. All parties are notified that effective 12-01-15 this case will be assigned to Reserved Branch, Branch 31, in Room 615 of the Courthouse.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Deputy Court Clerk: TC.Parole Agent Donna Karolewicz contacted the Court to inform that defendant is in custody at MSDF on a pending revocation.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court prior to case being called.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pre-trial conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Christopher D Hughes in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Christopher D Hughes in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher D Hughes
Current: 6921 N Teutonia Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 09-25-2015)
Prior: 3323 North Richards Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
